vn_meaning: tính từ: mong muốn; tốt; đáng mong muốn; phù hợp
eng_explanation: adjective: wanted or wished for; good or desirable.
example: A comfortable home is a desirable goal.
She has desirable qualities like kindness and intelligence.
The company offers desirable benefits to its employees.

vn_meaning: danh từ: mong muốn, khát khao (cảm xúc); động từ: mong muốn, thèm muốn (hành động)
eng_explanation: desire (n/v): a strong feeling of wanting something or wishing for it.
example: She has a strong desire to travel the world.
I desire nothing more than to be happy.
He expressed his desire for a promotion.

vn_meaning: danh từ: bàn làm việc
eng_explanation: desk (n): a table-like piece of furniture used for writing or working at.
example: She organized her papers on her desk.
He sat at his desk, reviewing the documents.
The desk was made of solid oak.

vn_meaning: danh từ: màn hình chính (của máy tính)
eng_explanation: desktop (n): the main screen of a computer after it starts up.
example: I organized my files on the desktop.
The desktop background is a beautiful landscape.
She customized her desktop with new icons.

vn_meaning: tính từ: tuyệt vọng, cấp bách
eng_explanation: desperate (adj): feeling or showing great distress or urgency.
example: He was desperate for help.
They were in a desperate situation.
She made a desperate plea for forgiveness.

vn_meaning: trạng từ: tuyệt vọng, cấp bách
eng_explanation: desperately (adv): in a way that shows great distress or urgency.
example: He needed the money desperately.
She clung to the rope desperately.
They searched for him desperately.

vn_meaning: tiền tố/giới từ: bất chấp, mặc dù
eng_explanation: despite (prep/conj): without being affected by something; in spite of something.
example: Despite the rain, they went for a walk.
He continued his work despite the difficulties.
Despite her best efforts, she failed the exam.

vn_meaning: danh từ: đích đến, điểm đến
eng_explanation: destination (n): the place to which someone is going or something is being sent.
example: Paris is our destination for the summer.
The package's destination was London.
The ship's final destination was New York.

vn_meaning: động từ: phá hủy, huỷ diệt
eng_explanation: destroy (v): to ruin or damage something so badly that it cannot be repaired.
example: The fire destroyed the entire building.
The storm destroyed the crops.
He destroyed all evidence.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự phá hủy, sự huỷ diệt
eng_explanation: destruction (n): the act of ruining or damaging something so badly that it cannot be repaired.
example: The destruction caused by the earthquake was immense.
The destruction of the rainforest is a serious problem.
The bombing resulted in widespread destruction.

vn_meaning: tính từ: phá hoại, gây hại
eng_explanation: destructive (adj): causing great and irreparable harm or damage.
example: The destructive storm left a trail of devastation.
His destructive behavior alienated his friends.
A destructive force is at work.

vn_meaning: tính từ: quyết tâm (trong hành động); kiên định (ý chí); đã quyết định (chắc chắn).
eng_explanation: adj. Firmly decided; resolute; having a strong will. (PoS: adj.)
example: She is determined to succeed in her career.
He was a determined opponent in the chess match.
The date of the meeting is determined.

vn_meaning: động từ: tàn phá (một vùng đất); gây ra thiệt hại lớn (về vật chất, tinh thần); làm suy sụp (tinh thần).
eng_explanation: v. To destroy or ruin; to cause severe damage or suffering. (PoS: v.)
example: The earthquake devastated the coastal city.
The news of her death devastated him.
The economic crisis devastated many businesses.

vn_meaning: động từ: phát triển (khả năng, kỹ năng); lớn lên (trẻ em); xây dựng (đất đai); phơi sáng (ảnh chụp).
eng_explanation: v. To grow or cause to grow; to elaborate or expand. (PoS: v.)
example: Children develop rapidly during their first years.
The company is developing a new product.
He developed a strong interest in music.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự phát triển (kinh tế, xã hội, cá nhân); quá trình lớn lên; sự xây dựng (đất đai).
eng_explanation: n. The process of growth or advancement; the act of developing. (PoS: n.)
example: Economic development is crucial for the country.
The development of the child was closely monitored.
The housing development is located on the outskirts of town.

vn_meaning: danh từ: dụng cụ; thiết bị; mưu kế, thủ đoạn.
eng_explanation: n. A tool or instrument designed for a specific purpose. (PoS: n.)
example: A smartphone is a useful device.
The police discovered a clever security device.
He used a clever device to open the lock.

vn_meaning: danh từ: quỷ dữ; kẻ ác; người tinh nghịch, khó đối phó.
eng_explanation: n. An evil spirit or demon; a wicked person. (PoS: n.)
example: According to some religions, the devil is the embodiment of evil.
He's a devil for details.
She was a devil to work with.

vn_meaning: động từ: nghĩ ra (kế hoạch, phương án); sáng tạo (cái gì đó).
eng_explanation: v. To plan or invent; to create a new method or system. (PoS: v.)
example: They devised a plan to escape.
She devised a new way to solve the problem.
The engineers devised a clever solution.

vn_meaning: động từ: dành (thời gian, công sức) cho; hiến dâng (bản thân) cho.
eng_explanation: v. To dedicate time or effort; to give oneself to a cause. (PoS: v.)
example: She devoted her life to helping others.
He devotes several hours each day to studying.
They devoted all their resources to the project.

vn_meaning: động từ: chẩn đoán (bệnh).
eng_explanation: v. To identify the nature of an illness or problem. (PoS: v.)
example: The doctor diagnosed her with the flu.
It's difficult to diagnose the cause of the problem.
The mechanic diagnosed a faulty engine.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự chẩn đoán (bệnh).
eng_explanation: n. The identification of the nature of an illness or problem. (PoS: n.)
example: The diagnosis was pneumonia.
She received a quick and accurate diagnosis.
The doctor explained the diagnosis to the patient.

vn_meaning: sơ đồ
eng_explanation: A diagram is a visual aid used to depict relationships and processes.
example: The scientist created a detailed diagram of the molecule.
The architect designed a complex diagram to show the building's layout.
She drew a simple diagram to explain the steps involved.

vn_meaning: A conversation between two or more people.
eng_explanation: A dialogue is a conversation where participants exchange ideas and information.
example: The negotiation required a careful dialogue between the parties.
The actors engaged in a lively dialogue during the play.
She enjoyed a thoughtful dialogue with her friend.

vn_meaning: kim cương
eng_explanation: A diamond is a hard, brilliant gemstone, symbolizing love and enduring relationships.
example: He gave her a diamond ring as a symbol of his love.
The story of the diamond was a testament to their enduring bond.
The diamond was a beautiful symbol of their commitment.

vn_meaning: A book in which one writes down events, thoughts, and feelings.
eng_explanation: A diary is a personal record of events, thoughts, and feelings.
example: She kept a diary to track her daily experiences.
The old man meticulously wrote in his diary every day.
She confided her secrets in her diary.

vn_meaning: ra lệnh
eng_explanation: To dictate means to give instructions or commands to someone, often in writing.
example: The teacher dictated the lesson to the students.
He dictated a lengthy letter to his secretary.
She dictated a poem to her muse.

vn_meaning: A ruler who holds power through force or coercion.
eng_explanation: A dictator is a ruler who exercises absolute power, often through force or oppression.
example: The dictator's regime was marked by widespread human rights abuses.
The dictator's policies led to economic hardship and social unrest.
He ruled with an iron fist, crushing dissent.

vn_meaning: từ điển
eng_explanation: A dictionary is a reference book that provides definitions and pronunciations of words.
example: I consulted the dictionary to understand the word 'ubiquitous'.
The dictionary helped me to learn the correct pronunciation of the word.
She used the dictionary to look up the meaning of unfamiliar words.

vn_meaning: chết
eng_explanation: To die is a natural process of death, ending a person's life.
example: The old man died peacefully in his sleep.
She died of a sudden illness.
The city was devastated by the fire.

vn_meaning: ăn kiêng
eng_explanation: A diet refers to the way one eats and consumes food and beverages.
example: She followed a healthy diet to maintain her fitness.
He had a strict diet to lose weight.
She tried a new diet with lots of vegetables.

vn_meaning: khác biệt
eng_explanation: To differ means to be different from something or someone.
example: The two countries have different cultures.
The two people had different opinions on the matter.
The differences between the two approaches were significant.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự khác biệt; tính từ: khác biệt
eng_explanation: Noun: The state of being unlike; adjective: not the same.
example: There is a significant difference between the two products.
They have different opinions on the matter.
The difference in height was noticeable.

vn_meaning: tính từ: khác nhau; danh từ: người khác
eng_explanation: Adjective: Not the same; noun: a person other than oneself.
example: These two apples are different colors.
They have different interests.
I met a different person at the party.

vn_meaning: động từ: phân biệt; phân biệt rõ ràng; làm nổi bật sự khác biệt
eng_explanation: Verb: To distinguish or make something stand out; to show differences.
example: It's important to differentiate between facts and opinions.
The marketing campaign aims to differentiate the product.
She tried to differentiate herself from the competition.

vn_meaning: trạng từ: một cách khác nhau
eng_explanation: Adverb: In a different way; contrasting with another manner.
example: Please do it differently next time.
She explained it differently to her brother.
They approached the problem differently.

vn_meaning: tính từ: khó khăn; khó; phức tạp
eng_explanation: Adjective: Not easy; presenting challenges or requiring effort.
example: This problem is very difficult to solve.
He found the task difficult.
The journey was difficult due to the weather.

vn_meaning: danh từ: khó khăn; sự khó khăn; trở ngại
eng_explanation: Noun: A problem or challenge; something that is hard to do.
example: He faced many difficulties during his travels.
The main difficulty was the lack of resources.
She overcame her difficulties with determination.

vn_meaning: động từ: đào; chôn; tìm kiếm (thông tin)
eng_explanation: Verb: To excavate; to search for information or hidden things.
example: The workers began to dig a tunnel.
He dug up a valuable artifact.
She dug for information about the company.

vn_meaning: tính từ: kỹ thuật số; liên quan đến kỹ thuật số
eng_explanation: Adjective: Relating to digital technology; existing in a digital form.
example: This is a digital photograph.
He works with digital data.
The company is going digital.

vn_meaning: danh từ: phẩm giá; sự cao thượng; tự trọng
eng_explanation: Noun: The state of being worthy of respect; self-respect.
example: He maintained his dignity throughout the ordeal.
She showed great dignity in the face of adversity.
Respect for dignity is essential in all relationships.

vn_meaning: danh từ: tình huống nan giải; mâu thuẫn nội tâm
eng_explanation: Noun: A difficult situation where you have to choose between two or more options.
example: He faced a difficult dilemma: stay or leave.
The company is in a financial dilemma.
She was in a moral dilemma.

vn_meaning: danh từ: chiều (không gian); chiều kích thước; khía cạnh (của vấn đề)
eng_explanation: noun: a measurable aspect of a thing; extent.
example: The painting has impressive depth and dimension.
Consider all dimensions of the problem before making a decision.
The new building added a modern dimension to the city skyline.

vn_meaning: động từ: làm giảm, làm yếu đi; suy giảm
eng_explanation: verb: to make or become smaller or less.
example: The noise began to diminish as the car drove away.
His enthusiasm diminished over time.
The impact of the policy will diminish over the next few years.

vn_meaning: danh từ: bữa tối
eng_explanation: noun: the main meal of the day, eaten in the evening.
example: We're having dinner at my parents' house tonight.
Let's order takeout for dinner.
A delicious dinner was prepared for the guests.

vn_meaning: động từ: nhúng; giảm nhẹ; thoái trào; danh từ: chỗ nhúng; sự giảm nhẹ
eng_explanation: verb: briefly put something into a liquid; decline slightly; noun: a brief immersion.
example: She dipped the bread into the olive oil.
The stock market experienced a slight dip today.
He took a dip in the pool.

vn_meaning: danh từ: nhà ngoại giao
eng_explanation: noun: an official who conducts negotiations between governments.
example: The diplomat presented his credentials to the president.
She is a skilled diplomat with years of experience.
International relations require careful diplomacy from diplomats.

vn_meaning: tính từ: ngoại giao; khéo léo trong giao tiếp
eng_explanation: adjective: relating to or suitable for diplomats; tactful.
example: The ambassador delivered a diplomatic response to the criticism.
He handled the situation with diplomatic skill.
A diplomatic solution is needed to resolve the conflict.

vn_meaning: tính từ: trực tiếp; thẳng; động từ: chỉ đạo; hướng dẫn; điều khiển
eng_explanation: adjective: straight; without intermediaries; verb: guide or control.
example: The direct route is faster.
He gave direct instructions to the team.
The director directly oversaw the project.

vn_meaning: danh từ: hướng; sự chỉ đạo; chỉ dẫn
eng_explanation: noun: a course along which something moves; guidance.
example: Follow the direction of the signs.
The company needs strong leadership and direction.
He gave me clear directions to his house.

vn_meaning: trạng từ: trực tiếp; ngay lập tức
eng_explanation: adverb: immediately; without intermediaries.
example: He contacted me directly.
The evidence directly contradicts his statement.
The train departs directly from platform 3.

vn_meaning: danh từ: giám đốc; đạo diễn
eng_explanation: noun: a person responsible for managing a company; a film director.
example: She is the director of marketing.
The director announced the start of filming.
The film's director received critical acclaim.

vn_meaning: tính từ: thất vọng (khi mong đợi không thành hiện thực); quá khứ phân từ của động từ 'disappoint'.
eng_explanation: adj. Feeling sadness or displeasure because someone or something has failed to fulfill one's hopes. (Past participle of 'disappoint')
example: She was disappointed when she learned the concert was canceled.
I was deeply disappointed by the team's performance.
He sounded disappointed on the phone.

vn_meaning: tính từ: gây thất vọng; không đáp ứng được mong đợi.
eng_explanation: adj. Causing sadness or displeasure; failing to fulfill someone's hopes or expectations.
example: The movie was quite disappointing, despite the good reviews.
It's disappointing that you can't come to the party.
The food was disappointing – bland and overpriced.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự thất vọng; cảm giác buồn bã khi điều mong muốn không xảy ra.
eng_explanation: n. The feeling of sadness or displeasure caused by the nonfulfillment of one's hopes or expectations.
example: To her disappointment, she didn't get the job.
He hid his disappointment well.
The cancellation of the trip was a great disappointment.

vn_meaning: danh từ: thảm họa; tai họa lớn gây thiệt hại nghiêm trọng về người và của.
eng_explanation: n. A sudden event, such as a flood, earthquake, or plane crash, causing great damage or suffering.
example: The earthquake was a major disaster.
The oil spill was an environmental disaster.
The company faced financial disaster after the scandal.

vn_meaning: tính từ: thảm khốc; gây ra tai họa lớn; cực kỳ tệ.
eng_explanation: adj. Causing great damage or suffering; extremely bad or unsuccessful.
example: The hurricane caused disastrous flooding.
The company's new product launch was a disastrous failure.
His decision proved disastrous for the team.

vn_meaning: danh từ: đĩa (nhạc); đĩa tròn (CD, DVD); đĩa mỏng (giải phẫu).
eng_explanation: n. A flat, circular object used to record or play music or data; an anatomical structure.
example: He put a disc in the CD player.
The doctor examined the spinal disc.
She collected vintage vinyl discs.

vn_meaning: động từ: vứt bỏ; loại bỏ; bỏ đi cái gì không cần thiết.
eng_explanation: v. To get rid of something as no longer useful or desirable.
example: Please discard the empty containers.
He decided to discard his old shoes.
The committee discarded several proposals.

vn_meaning: động từ: xuất viện; giải phóng; xả (điện, chất lỏng); thực hiện nghĩa vụ (quân sự).; danh từ: sự xuất viện; sự giải phóng; sự xả.
eng_explanation: v. To release or allow to leave (e.g., a patient from hospital); to perform a duty. n. The release of something.
example: The patient was discharged from the hospital yesterday.
The factory is illegally discharging waste into the river.
He completed his military discharge.

vn_meaning: danh từ: kỷ luật; sự rèn luyện; sự trừng phạt; động từ: kỷ luật; rèn luyện; trừng phạt.
eng_explanation: n. The practice of training people to obey rules or a code of behavior. v. To train to obey rules.
example: The school has a strict discipline policy.
He needs to discipline himself to study more.
The children were disciplined for their misbehavior.

vn_meaning: động từ: tiết lộ; bộc lộ; làm cho hiển nhiên.
eng_explanation: v. To make known something that was previously secret or private.
example: The company refused to disclose the details of the deal.
He disclosed his past to her.
The investigation disclosed several irregularities.

vn_meaning: tiết lộ
eng_explanation: To reveal information; to expose secrets; to inform.
example: The company will disclose its financial results next week.
The police investigation revealed a significant disclosure.
She disclosed her pregnancy to her friends.

vn_meaning: giảm giá
eng_explanation: A price reduction; a lower price.
example: We're getting a discount on all summer apparel.
The store offers a 20% discount on select items.
She found a great discount on her favorite book.

vn_meaning: mất lòng
eng_explanation: To prevent someone from doing something; to urge not to do something.
example: The government is trying to discourage smoking.
His words encouraged her to pursue her dreams.
The company is trying to discourage employees from gossiping.

vn_meaning: khóa luận
eng_explanation: A discussion or debate; a conversation.
example: The professor led a lively discourse on the history of art.
They had a difficult discourse about the project's challenges.
The debate was a lengthy discourse on the issue.

vn_meaning: To find something unexpectedly; to learn something new.
eng_explanation: To find something unexpectedly; to learn something new.
example: The scientists discovered a new species of plant.
She discovered a hidden treasure in the attic.
We discovered a new route to the city.

vn_meaning: khám phá
eng_explanation: The act of finding something new; a new finding.
example: The scientific discovery revolutionized our understanding of the universe.
The discovery of penicillin saved countless lives.
She made a remarkable discovery about the local wildlife.

vn_meaning: thận trọng
eng_explanation: Carefulness and restraint; modesty and privacy.
example: She showed great discretion when discussing her personal matters.
He displayed a high degree of discretion in handling confidential information.
She exercised discretion in choosing what to reveal.

vn_meaning: The act of treating people unfairly based on their race, religion, gender, or other characteristics.
eng_explanation: Unfair treatment; prejudice.
example: The company's discriminatory hiring practices are a serious issue.
He faced discrimination in the workplace.
We must combat discrimination in all its forms.

vn_meaning: thảo luận
eng_explanation: To talk about something in detail; to debate.
example: Let's discuss the implications of this new policy.
They discussed the best way to solve the problem.
We need to discuss the details of the meeting.

vn_meaning: thảo luận
eng_explanation: A conversation or debate; a discussion.
example: The class had a lively discussion about the assigned reading.
They engaged in a thoughtful discussion about the historical events.
The discussion was focused on the key arguments.

vn_meaning: danh từ: bệnh (bệnh tật); tính từ: bệnh (liên quan đến bệnh)
eng_explanation: Noun: A condition that impairs normal functioning; Adjective: Relating to illness.
example: The patient was diagnosed with a serious disease.
Many diseases are caused by viruses.
She suffered from a chronic disease.

vn_meaning: danh từ: đĩa ăn; danh từ: món ăn (bữa ăn); tính từ: vụng về (hành động)
eng_explanation: Noun: A plate or utensil; Noun: A prepared meal; Adjective: Awkward or clumsy.
example: He served the dinner on a large dish.
She made a delicious fish dish.
He was acting rather disharmoniously.

vn_meaning: tính từ: không trung thực; không liêm khiết
eng_explanation: Adjective: Not honest; lacking integrity or truthfulness.
example: He was accused of being dishonest.
Dishonest behavior can damage relationships.
It's important to be honest and dishonest.

vn_meaning: danh từ: đĩa (vinyl, cứng, mềm); danh từ: ổ đĩa (máy tính)
eng_explanation: Noun: A circular plate (vinyl or storage); Noun: A computer storage device.
example: She listened to music on a vinyl disk.
The computer uses a hard disk for storage.
He collected antique disks.

vn_meaning: động từ: không thích; không ưa; tính từ: không thích
eng_explanation: Verb: To feel aversion or dislike; Adjective: Feeling aversion or dislike.
example: I dislike the rain.
She dislikes his behavior.
I strongly dislike that movie.

vn_meaning: động từ: sa thải; bác bỏ; xua đi
eng_explanation: Verb: To discharge from a job; To reject or deny; To drive away.
example: The manager dismissed the employee.
She dismissed his argument as foolish.
The wind dismissed the clouds.

vn_meaning: danh từ: việc sa thải; sự bác bỏ
eng_explanation: Noun: The act of dismissing someone; The rejection of an idea or claim.
example: His dismissal was a shock to everyone.
The dismissal of the case was upheld.
She received a formal dismissal letter.

vn_meaning: danh từ: hỗn loạn; rối loạn; bệnh (bệnh tâm thần)
eng_explanation: Noun: A state of confusion or disorder; Noun: A mental illness; Noun: A disturbance.
example: There was a state of disorder in the room.
He suffered from a severe mental disorder.
The police investigated the disorder.

vn_meaning: động từ: thay thế; đẩy ra khỏi vị trí; gây ra sự mất chỗ
eng_explanation: Verb: To replace or displace; To force out of a position.
example: The new technology will displace many jobs.
The earthquake displaced thousands of people.
He displaced her from her position.

vn_meaning: động từ: trưng bày; thể hiện; tính từ: hiển thị
eng_explanation: Verb: To show or exhibit; Noun: A public exhibition; Adjective: Visible or apparent.
example: The museum displays ancient artifacts.
She displayed her talent in the performance.
The screen displays the results.

vn_meaning: danh từ: việc xử lý, thải bỏ (rác thải, tài sản); sự bố trí, sắp xếp (tiền bạc, nguồn lực)
eng_explanation: noun: the action or process of getting rid of something; arrangement or allocation.
example: The proper disposal of hazardous waste is crucial for environmental protection.
The company made a generous disposal of funds to local charities.
We need a plan for the disposal of old equipment.

vn_meaning: động từ: xử lý, thải bỏ; bố trí, sắp xếp; có ý định làm gì (thường là tiêu cực)
eng_explanation: verb: to get rid of; to arrange or allocate; to be inclined to do something.
example: Please dispose of the trash in the designated bins.
The government decided to dispose of the surplus land.
He seemed disposed to argue about the details.

vn_meaning: danh từ: tranh chấp, bất đồng; động từ: tranh cãi, tranh luận
eng_explanation: noun: a disagreement or argument; verb: to argue or disagree about something.
example: The two countries are currently in a trade dispute.
They disputed the findings of the report.
There was a heated dispute over the inheritance.

vn_meaning: động từ: làm gián đoạn, phá rối; gây xáo trộn
eng_explanation: verb: to interrupt or disturb something; to cause disorder.
example: The storm disrupted power supplies across the region.
His sudden announcement disrupted the meeting.
Social media can disrupt traditional news sources.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự gián đoạn, phá rối; sự xáo trộn
eng_explanation: noun: the act of interrupting or disturbing something; a disturbance.
example: The flight was delayed due to a major disruption at the airport.
The economic disruption caused by the pandemic was significant.
There was a brief disruption to the internet service.

vn_meaning: động từ: hòa tan; tan ra; giải thể (tổ chức)
eng_explanation: verb: to pass into a solution; to break up or disband (an organization).
example: The sugar quickly dissolved in the hot water.
The company decided to dissolve the partnership.
The ice cream began to dissolve in the sun.

vn_meaning: danh từ: khoảng cách; động từ: cách xa
eng_explanation: noun: a measure of how far apart two things are; verb: to keep apart.
example: The distance between the two cities is about 100 miles.
She tried to distance herself from the scandal.
The telescope allows us to see objects at great distances.

vn_meaning: tính từ: xa xôi; lạnh lùng, xa cách

She managed the project efficiently.

vn_meaning: danh từ: nỗ lực; cố gắng (để đạt được điều gì đó).
eng_explanation: n. A vigorous or determined attempt. (attempt/exertion)
example: It took a lot of effort to finish the project.
She made a great effort to learn the language.
His efforts were rewarded with success.

vn_meaning: Một loại quả hoặc vật nuôi có vỏ ngoài, thường dùng để ăn hoặc làm đồ trang trí.
eng_explanation: An egg is a shelled fruit or poultry, often eaten or used for decoration.
example: I bought an egg for breakfast.
She laid an egg in the garden.

vn_meaning: Phần riêng của một người, ý thức chủ quan.
eng_explanation: The ego is a part of a person's consciousness, representing their self-awareness.
example: He struggled with his ego's need for validation.
She developed a strong ego to protect herself.

vn_meaning: Số 8, một số lượng lớn.
eng_explanation: Eight is a number representing a large quantity.
example: We have eight friends.
He is an eight-year-old boy.

vn_meaning: Số 18, một số lượng lớn.
eng_explanation: Eighteen is a number representing a large quantity.
example: They spent eighteen dollars on the trip.
He is eighteen years old.

vn_meaning: Số 80, một số lượng lớn.
eng_explanation: Eighty is a number representing a large quantity.
example: The store had eighty percent off.
He is eighty years old.

vn_meaning: Cả hai, một trong hai.
eng_explanation: Either means either or both.
example: She chose either coffee or tea.
He has both a car and a bicycle.

vn_meaning: Phức tạp, chi tiết, tỉ mỉ.
eng_explanation: To elaborate means to make something more detailed or complex.
example: The architect elaborated on the design.
She elaborated on her feelings about the situation.

vn_meaning: Cẳng tay, một phần của cơ thể.
eng_explanation: The elbow is a part of the arm.
example: He straightened his elbow.
She leaned on her elbow for support.

vn_meaning: Tuổi già, già nua.
eng_explanation: Elderly refers to someone who is old.
example: The elderly couple sat on the porch.
She is an elderly woman.

vn_meaning: Chọn, lựa chọn.
eng_explanation: Elect means to choose.
example: He was elected as the mayor.
She chose to elect a new candidate.

vn_meaning: danh từ: cuộc bầu cử; tính từ: liên quan đến bầu cử
eng_explanation: Noun: The process of choosing a person or group into office. Adjective: Relating to elections.
example: The upcoming election is a crucial event for the country.
Voters lined up to cast their ballots in the election.
He campaigned tirelessly for the election.

vn_meaning: danh từ: hệ thống bầu cử; tính từ: liên quan đến bầu cử
eng_explanation: Adjective: Relating to or characteristic of an election or elections.
example: The electoral system was reformed to ensure fairness.
Electoral campaigns are often expensive and competitive.
She studied electoral law at university.

vn_meaning: danh từ: điện; tính từ: có điện; trạng từ: nhanh như điện
eng_explanation: Adjective: Containing or using electricity. Noun: Electricity itself. Adverb: Very quickly.
example: The electric car is becoming increasingly popular.
He felt an electric shock when he touched the wire.
The train traveled electric fast.

vn_meaning: danh từ: hệ thống điện; tính từ: liên quan đến điện
eng_explanation: Adjective: Relating to electricity or electrical systems. Noun: Electrical equipment or wiring.
example: The electrical grid needs to be upgraded.
He is an electrical engineer.
The electrical outlet was not working.

vn_meaning: danh từ: điện; năng lượng điện
eng_explanation: Noun: The flow of electric charge. It is a form of energy.
example: Electricity powers our homes and businesses.
The lightning produced a huge burst of electricity.
She studied the properties of electricity in college.

vn_meaning: danh từ: thiết bị điện tử; tính từ: điện tử
eng_explanation: Adjective: Relating to electronics or electronic devices. Noun: An electronic device.
example: The electronic store had a wide selection of gadgets.
He works with electronic components.
The electronic book is lighter than a paper book.

vn_meaning: danh từ: thiết bị điện tử; ngành công nghiệp điện tử
eng_explanation: Noun: Electronic devices and equipment.  The industry that produces them.
example: The company specializes in consumer electronics.
He is a graduate in electronics engineering.
The latest electronics are very sophisticated.

vn_meaning: danh từ: vẻ đẹp; tính từ: thanh lịch, duyên dáng
eng_explanation: Adjective: Graceful and stylish. Noun: A beautiful and refined appearance.
example: She wore an elegant dress to the party.
The building had an elegant design.
His speech was elegant and persuasive.

vn_meaning: danh từ: nguyên tố; thành phần; yếu tố cơ bản
eng_explanation: Noun: A fundamental part of something.  A basic component or ingredient.
example: Hydrogen is a key element in water.
Each element has unique properties.
The element of surprise was crucial to their success.

vn_meaning: danh từ: cơ bản; tính từ: cơ bản, sơ cấp
eng_explanation: Adjective: Basic or fundamental. Noun: A simple or introductory lesson.
example: The course covered elementary mathematics.
He struggled with the elementary concepts.
She found the book to be elementary in its approach.

vn_meaning: danh từ: con voi (động vật); tính từ: thuộc về voi (liên quan đến voi)
eng_explanation: noun: a large mammal with a trunk; adjective: relating to elephants.
example: The circus featured a magnificent elephant.
Elephant tusks are often made of ivory.
We visited an elephant sanctuary in Thailand.

vn_meaning: động từ: nâng lên; làm cho cao hơn; đề cao, tôn vinh
eng_explanation: verb: to raise to a higher position or level; to enhance.
example: Please elevate the box to the top shelf.
The award will elevate her career.
The speaker sought to elevate the discussion.

vn_meaning: danh từ: mười một
eng_explanation: noun: the number 11.
example: There were eleven players on the field.
I have eleven fingers and toes.
She turned eleven years old last week.

vn_meaning: tính từ: đủ điều kiện; có quyền tham gia
eng_explanation: adjective: qualified or suitable; meeting requirements.
example: He is eligible to vote in the next election.
Are you eligible for the scholarship?
She was deemed eligible for the competition.

vn_meaning: động từ: loại bỏ; loại trừ; khống chế
eng_explanation: verb: to remove or exclude; to get rid of.
example: The team eliminated their opponents in the first round.
We need to eliminate waste from the process.
The medicine helped eliminate the infection.

vn_meaning: danh từ: tinh tú; giới thượng lưu; tính từ: tinh nhuệ; ưu tú
eng_explanation: noun: the best or most select people; adjective: of the highest quality.
example: The elite athletes trained rigorously for the Olympics.
She belongs to an elite social circle.
This is an elite brand of coffee.

vn_meaning: trạng từ: khác; còn nữa
eng_explanation: adverb: other than that; something different.
example: I don't like coffee; I'll have tea else.
Is there anything else I can do for you?
If you don't want this, what else would you like?

vn_meaning: trạng từ: ở nơi khác; ở một nơi nào đó khác
eng_explanation: adverb: in another place; somewhere else.
example: I couldn't find my keys here, so I looked elsewhere.
She decided to travel elsewhere for her vacation.
He spent his childhood elsewhere in Europe.

vn_meaning: danh từ: thư điện tử; động từ: gửi thư điện tử
eng_explanation: noun: electronic messages sent over the internet; verb: to send an email.
example: I received an email from my boss.
Please email me the report by Friday.
I need to check my email regularly.

vn_meaning: động từ: lên tàu, lên máy bay; bắt đầu (một hành trình, dự án)
eng_explanation: verb: to board a ship or aircraft; to begin or undertake.
example: We will embark on a cruise next month.
The company is embarking on a new project.
She embarked on a career in medicine.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự phát ra; sự thải ra (khí, ánh sáng, âm thanh,...).
eng_explanation: n. The act of sending something out; the release of energy or particles. [NOUN]
example: The factory's emissions are carefully monitored.
Carbon emissions contribute to global warming.
There was a loud emission of steam.

vn_meaning: danh từ: cảm xúc; tình cảm (yêu, ghét, vui, buồn,...).
eng_explanation: n. A strong feeling deriving from one's circumstances, mood, or relationships. [NOUN]
example: Her face showed no emotion.
Love is a powerful emotion.
He struggled to control his emotions.

vn_meaning: tính từ: thuộc về cảm xúc; dễ xúc động; tình cảm.
eng_explanation: adj. Relating to or influenced by emotions. [ADJ]
example: It was a very emotional moment.
She is a highly emotional person.
The film is emotionally draining.

vn_meaning: trạng từ: một cách tình cảm; một cách xúc động.
eng_explanation: adv. In a way that relates to or is influenced by emotions. [ADV]
example: He became emotionally attached to the project.
She was emotionally exhausted after the ordeal.
He reacted emotionally to the news.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự nhấn mạnh; trọng điểm; trọng âm.
eng_explanation: n. Special importance, value, or prominence given to something. [NOUN]
example: The teacher placed emphasis on grammar.
The report puts emphasis on the need for change.
There was a strong emphasis on safety.

vn_meaning: động từ: nhấn mạnh; làm nổi bật; đề cao.
eng_explanation: v. To give special importance or prominence to something. [VERB]
example: She emphasized the importance of teamwork.
The report emphasizes the need for further research.
Let me emphasize that this is a serious matter.

vn_meaning: danh từ: đế quốc; vương quốc lớn mạnh; quyền lực thống trị.
eng_explanation: n. An extensive group of states or countries ruled over by a single monarch, government, or power. [NOUN]
example: The Roman Empire dominated Europe for centuries.
He built a business empire from scratch.
The British Empire once spanned the globe.

vn_meaning: tính từ: dựa trên kinh nghiệm; thực nghiệm; quan sát.
eng_explanation: adj. Based on observation or experience rather than theory or pure logic. [ADJ]
example: The study was based on empirical evidence.
Empirical research is crucial in science.
He made an empirical observation about the phenomenon.

vn_meaning: động từ: tuyển dụng; sử dụng (người, vật); dùng (phương pháp,...).
eng_explanation: v. To give work or a job to someone; to make use of. [VERB]
example: The company employs over 500 people.
She employed a clever strategy to win the game.
They employed all available resources.

vn_meaning: danh từ: nhân viên; người làm công.
eng_explanation: n. A person employed for wages or salary. [NOUN]
example: The company has a dedicated team of employees.
Employee satisfaction is a top priority.
He is a valued employee of the firm.

vn_meaning: A person or organization that employs others.
eng_explanation: An employer is a company or individual who hires and manages workers.
example: The company is looking for a new employer for its employees.
She is an employer of many talented individuals.

vn_meaning: việc làm
eng_explanation: Employment refers to the act of working for an employer.
example: He has a stable employment in the software industry.
She is seeking a new employment opportunity.

vn_meaning: trao quyền
eng_explanation: Empowerment means to give someone the ability to make decisions and take action.
example: The new regulations will empower small businesses.
She felt empowered to speak her mind.

vn_meaning: Having no contents or substance.
eng_explanation: An empty object or space is devoid of anything.
example: The box was empty of all its contents.
There was an empty chair at the table.

vn_meaning: khả thi
eng_explanation: To enable something means to provide the means for it to happen.
example: The software is enabled to run on any device.
We need to enable the system to access the internet.

vn_meaning: thực hiện
eng_explanation: Enact means to formally pass a law or piece of legislation.
example: The government is debating to enact new environmental regulations.
The bill was enacted after a lengthy debate.

vn_meaning: bao gồm
eng_explanation: To encompass means to include or cover something completely.
example: The project will encompass all aspects of the business.
The report encompasses the key findings of the study.

vn_meaning: A meeting or situation where two or more people come into contact.
eng_explanation: An encounter is a meeting or situation where people interact.
example: She had a difficult encounter with a stranger on the street.
We had an unexpected encounter with a long-lost friend.

vn_meaning: khuyến khích
eng_explanation: To encourage someone means to give them the motivation to do something.
example: The manager encouraged his employees to work harder.
She encouraged her friend to pursue her dreams.

vn_meaning: Words or actions that motivate or inspire someone.
eng_explanation: Encouragement is a form of motivation that inspires someone to do something.
example: His words of encouragement helped her overcome her doubts.
The team provided encouragement during the challenging project.

vn_meaning: tính từ: khích lệ (người); động từ: khuyến khích (hành động)
eng_explanation: Adjective: promoting hope; Verb: to inspire or support.
example: The teacher gave the students encouraging words.
He encouraged her to pursue her dreams.
Her encouraging attitude helped me through a difficult time.

vn_meaning: danh từ: kết thúc; động từ: kết thúc, chấm dứt
eng_explanation: Noun: the state of being finished; Verb: to bring to an end.
example: The end of the movie was shocking.
Please end the meeting promptly.
He ended the conversation abruptly.

vn_meaning: danh từ: nỗ lực, gắng sức; tính từ: đáng nỗ lực, đáng giá
eng_explanation: Noun: an attempt or effort; Adjective: worthy of effort or attention.
example: She made an endeavour to learn a new language.
It was a difficult endeavour, but he succeeded.
The company's endeavours to improve customer service were appreciated.

vn_meaning: danh từ: kết thúc, hồi kết; tính từ: kết thúc
eng_explanation: Noun: the final part of something; Adjective: final or concluding.
example: The ending of the book was unexpected.
She enjoyed the ending of the movie.
The ending of the war brought relief to the people.

vn_meaning: tính từ: vô tận, không có hồi kết
eng_explanation: Adjective: without limit or end.
example: The desert stretched out endlessly.
She had an endless supply of patience.
The possibilities seemed endless.

vn_meaning: động từ: ủng hộ, bênh vực; (văn phong) xác nhận, chứng thực
eng_explanation: Verb: to publicly support; (formal) to confirm the authenticity of.
example: He endorsed the politician's policies.
The company endorsed the product's quality.
The document was endorsed by the CEO.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự ủng hộ, sự bênh vực; (văn phong) xác nhận, chứng thực
eng_explanation: Noun: an expression of support; (formal) an official confirmation.
example: The celebrity's endorsement boosted sales.
She received an endorsement from a respected expert.
The product's endorsement was widely publicized.

vn_meaning: động từ: chịu đựng, tồn tại, bền bỉ
eng_explanation: Verb: to withstand or tolerate; to last a long time.
example: He endured the pain with courage.
The city endured a long period of drought.
She endured many hardships in her life.

vn_meaning: danh từ: kẻ thù, đối thủ
eng_explanation: Noun: a person or group opposed to someone or something.
example: The two countries were long-time enemies.
He considered his rivals his enemies.
The enemy forces launched an attack.

vn_meaning: danh từ: năng lượng, sức mạnh; tính từ: tràn đầy năng lượng
eng_explanation: Noun: the ability to do work; Adjective: full of energy.
example: The solar panels generate energy.
She has a lot of energy and enthusiasm.
The city is investing in renewable energy sources.

vn_meaning: động từ: thi hành, thực thi (luật, quy định); bắt buộc tuân thủ (quy tắc).
eng_explanation: to compel obedience to a law, rule, or obligation; to make someone do something.
example: The police were sent to enforce the new traffic laws.
The company is working to enforce its copyright.
It's important to enforce the rules fairly.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự thi hành, sự thực thi (luật, quy định); sự bắt buộc tuân thủ.
eng_explanation: the process of making sure a law, rule, or order is obeyed.
example: The enforcement of environmental regulations is crucial.
Increased police enforcement led to a decrease in crime.
The new law's enforcement will be closely monitored.

vn_meaning: động từ: tham gia, hòa mình vào; bắt đầu (một hoạt động); lôi cuốn, thu hút (sự chú ý).
eng_explanation: to participate or become involved in something; to attract and hold interest.
example: She decided to engage in a new hobby.
The company is engaged in a major project.
The speaker's engaging style captivated the audience.

vn_meaning: tính từ: đính hôn; bận rộn, đang làm gì đó; được thuê, được sử dụng.
eng_explanation: promised to marry; occupied or busy with something; contracted for a specific purpose.
example: She is happily engaged to be married.
He's engaged in a complex research project.
The venue is already engaged for the evening.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự đính hôn; sự tham gia, sự hòa mình; sự lôi cuốn, sự thu hút.
eng_explanation: the state of being engaged or promised to marry; involvement in an activity; the act of attracting interest.
example: They announced their engagement last week.
Her engagement in the community is admirable.
The film's engaging plot kept us on the edge of our seats.

vn_meaning: tính từ: lôi cuốn, hấp dẫn; thú vị, gây hứng thú.
eng_explanation: attractive, interesting, and capable of attracting and holding attention.
example: The speaker gave an engaging presentation.
It was an engaging conversation.
The museum offers engaging exhibits for children.

vn_meaning: danh từ: động cơ; cỗ máy.
eng_explanation: a machine that produces mechanical power; a driving force.
example: The car's engine needs to be serviced.
The engine of the economy is small businesses.
The ship's engine was powerful.

vn_meaning: danh từ: kỹ sư; người thiết kế, người chế tạo; người tìm cách thực hiện điều gì đó.
eng_explanation: a person who designs, builds, or maintains engines, machines, or structures; a person who finds clever ways to do things.
example: She is a talented civil engineer.
The engineers are working on a new bridge design.
He's an engineer who can solve any problem.

vn_meaning: danh từ: kỹ thuật; ngành kỹ thuật; việc thiết kế, chế tạo.
eng_explanation: the design, construction, and maintenance of engines, machines, or structures.
example: He studied engineering at university.
Advances in engineering have transformed our lives.
The project requires careful engineering planning.

vn_meaning: động từ: nâng cao, cải thiện; làm tăng thêm vẻ đẹp.
eng_explanation: to improve the quality, amount, or strength of something; to intensify or increase.
example: The new software will enhance productivity.
The decorations enhance the beauty of the room.
The company is looking for ways to enhance its brand image.

vn_meaning: động từ: đi vào (một nơi nào đó); nhập (thông tin, dữ liệu); đăng ký tham gia (cuộc thi, khóa học).
eng_explanation: v. to come or go into (a place); to input (data).
example: Please enter your password.
She decided to enter the race.
He entered the building quietly.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự nghiệp; tinh thần kinh doanh; xí nghiệp, công ty.
eng_explanation: n. a project or undertaking, especially a difficult or complex one; a business.
example: She launched a new business enterprise.
The company is known for its innovative enterprise.
It was a risky enterprise, but it paid off.

vn_meaning: động từ: giải trí; tiếp đãi; làm cho vui.
eng_explanation: v. to provide amusement or enjoyment; to have guests for food and drink.
example: The clown entertained the children.
We entertained our guests with a delicious dinner.
The movie was very entertaining.

vn_meaning: tính từ: thú vị, gây cười; hấp dẫn.
eng_explanation: adj. amusing and enjoyable; interesting.
example: The book was very entertaining.
He is an entertaining speaker.
We had a very entertaining evening.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự giải trí; các chương trình giải trí.
eng_explanation: n. the action of providing amusement or enjoyment.
example: The city offers a wide range of entertainment.
Live music is a popular form of entertainment.
The entertainment industry is very competitive.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự nhiệt tình; sự hăng hái.
eng_explanation: n. intense and eager enjoyment, interest, or approval.
example: She spoke with great enthusiasm.
He showed little enthusiasm for the project.
Their enthusiasm was contagious.

vn_meaning: danh từ: người nhiệt tình; người hâm mộ.
eng_explanation: n. a person filled with enthusiasm for something.
example: He is a car enthusiast.
A wine enthusiast, she knows a lot about different vintages.
The club is full of gardening enthusiasts.

vn_meaning: tính từ: nhiệt tình; hăng hái; đầy nhiệt huyết.
eng_explanation: adj. having or showing intense and eager enjoyment, interest, or approval.
example: She is an enthusiastic supporter of the team.
He gave an enthusiastic response.
They were enthusiastic about the new plan.

vn_meaning: tính từ: toàn bộ; đầy đủ; không thiếu gì.
eng_explanation: adj. whole; complete; not divided or incomplete.
example: He ate the entire cake.
The entire family went on vacation.
The entire process took several hours.

vn_meaning: trạng từ: hoàn toàn; toàn bộ; trọn vẹn.
eng_explanation: adv. completely; totally; absolutely.
example: I entirely agree with you.
The success was entirely due to her efforts.
It is entirely up to you.

vn_meaning: được ủy quyền, được phép, có quyền
eng_explanation: To be granted permission or authority to do something.
example: The company entitled the employee to a bonus.
The judge entitled the defendant to a fair trial.

vn_meaning: thực thể, đối tượng, sự tồn tại
eng_explanation: A single, identifiable thing or concept.
example: The entity was identified as the source of the contamination.
The research entity focused on a specific population.

vn_meaning: đầu vào, cửa ra vào, điểm vào
eng_explanation: The way something enters or is accessed.
example: The entrance to the museum was guarded by security.
The entrance to the building was blocked by a landslide.

vn_meaning: người kinh doanh, chủ doanh nghiệp
eng_explanation: A person who starts and runs a business.
example: The entrepreneur invested heavily in the new technology.
She is an ambitious entrepreneur with a strong vision.

vn_meaning: đầu vào, sự nhập vào, sự tiếp cận
eng_explanation: The act of entering or coming into a place.
example: The entry to the park was a beautiful garden.
The entry to the building was a narrow corridor.

vn_meaning: bưu điện, hộp thư, bao bì
eng_explanation: A sealed package for sending letters or documents.
example: The package contained an important envelope.
She received an envelope with a thank you note.

vn_meaning: môi trường, môi trường sống, môi trường tự nhiên
eng_explanation: The natural world or surroundings.
example: The environmental impact of the factory is a concern.
She enjoys spending time in nature.

vn_meaning: về môi trường, ảnh hưởng môi trường
eng_explanation: Relating to the natural world and its processes.
example: The environmental regulations are designed to protect the ecosystem.
The company is committed to sustainable environmental practices.

vn_meaning: mùa bùng phát, dịch bệnh bùng phát
eng_explanation: A sudden increase in the number of cases of a disease.
example: The flu epidemic threatened to overwhelm the healthcare system.
The outbreak of the virus caused widespread concern.

vn_meaning: mùa hội, sự kiện
eng_explanation: A single event or occurrence.
example: The medical episode required immediate attention.
The news report covered a dramatic episode of the crime.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự bằng nhau (giá trị, số lượng); tính từ: bằng nhau; trạng từ: như nhau
eng_explanation: Adjective: having the same value or quantity. Noun: the state of being equal.
example: The two equations must be equal.
They achieved equal rights.
The weights were equal.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự bình đẳng; sự tương đương
eng_explanation: Noun: the state of being equal; fairness and impartiality.
example: She fought for gender equality.
The law guarantees equality before the court.
Equality of opportunity is a key principle.

vn_meaning: trạng từ: như nhau; bằng nhau
eng_explanation: Adverb: in the same way or degree; to the same extent.
example: He played equally well on both sides.
They were equally responsible for the mistake.
The two teams performed equally.

vn_meaning: danh từ: phương trình; công thức toán học
eng_explanation: Noun: a mathematical statement showing equality between two expressions.
example: Solve the equation for x.
The equation is simple to solve.
He used an equation to calculate the distance.

vn_meaning: động từ: trang bị; cung cấp thiết bị
eng_explanation: Verb: to supply with equipment; to furnish.
example: The soldiers were equipped for the battle.
The company will equip its new factory.
She equipped her lab with the necessary tools.

vn_meaning: danh từ: thiết bị; đồ dùng; trang bị
eng_explanation: Noun: tools, machinery, or other items used in a particular activity or occupation.
example: The equipment malfunctioned during the experiment.
The museum displayed a wide range of equipment.
He needed specialized equipment for the job.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự tương đương; thứ tương đương; tính từ: tương đương
eng_explanation: Noun: something that is equivalent to something else. Adjective: having the same value or effect.
example: The two currencies are equivalent.
There is no equivalent to the feeling of love.
They found an equivalent solution.

vn_meaning: danh từ: thời kỳ; kỷ; giai đoạn
eng_explanation: Noun: a long and distinct period of history with a particular characteristic.
example: The Victorian era was known for its social reforms.
The Stone Age was a prehistoric era.
This era of technological advancement is exciting.

vn_meaning: động từ: dựng; xây; đứng thẳng
eng_explanation: Verb: to build or raise; to stand upright.
example: The builders erected a new skyscraper.
He erected a statue in her honor.
She stood erect with pride.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sai sót; lỗi; lầm; tính từ: sai lầm
eng_explanation: Noun: a mistake or inaccuracy. Adjective: containing or showing an error.
example: There was an error in the calculation.
He made a grave error in judgment.
The system detected an error.

vn_meaning: động từ: phun trào (núi lửa, chất lỏng); bùng nổ (cảm xúc, xung đột); đột ngột xuất hiện (vấn đề)
eng_explanation: verb: to suddenly and violently burst forth; to break out (of a situation).
example: The volcano erupted, sending ash and lava into the sky.
Tensions escalated and the argument erupted into a full-blown fight.
New problems have erupted since the company's restructuring.

vn_meaning: động từ: leo thang (mức độ, căng thẳng); tăng dần (giá cả, chi phí)
eng_explanation: verb: to increase rapidly; to become more intense or severe.
example: The conflict escalated quickly, leading to war.
Prices for energy are expected to escalate in the coming months.
The company needs to escalate its marketing efforts to reach a wider audience.

vn_meaning: động từ: trốn thoát (khỏi nơi giam giữ, nguy hiểm); tránh né (tình huống khó khăn); danh từ: sự trốn thoát
eng_explanation: verb: to break free from confinement or danger; to avoid (something).
example: He managed to escape from prison.
She escaped a potentially dangerous situation by acting quickly.
The escape from the burning building was a miracle.

vn_meaning: trạng từ: đặc biệt là; nhất là
eng_explanation: adverb: particularly; notably; more than others.
example: I enjoy classical music, especially Mozart.
She is especially good at solving complex problems.
We need to focus especially on improving customer service.

vn_meaning: danh từ: bài luận; động từ: viết bài luận
eng_explanation: noun: a short piece of writing on a particular subject; verb: to write an essay.
example: She wrote a compelling essay on the importance of education.
The student was assigned to essay about their summer vacation.
He spent hours essaying the topic of climate change.

vn_meaning: danh từ: bản chất; tinh túy; điều cốt yếu
eng_explanation: noun: the intrinsic nature or indispensable quality of something.
example: The essence of the argument is that people need freedom.
The perfume captured the essence of a summer garden.
What is the essence of happiness?

vn_meaning: tính từ: cần thiết; quan trọng; danh từ: thứ cần thiết
eng_explanation: adjective: absolutely necessary; vitally important; noun: something absolutely necessary.
example: Water is essential for life.
Good communication is essential for a successful relationship.
He packed the essentials for his camping trip.

vn_meaning: trạng từ: về cơ bản; bản chất là
eng_explanation: adverb: fundamentally; in essence; basically.
example: The plan is essentially sound, but needs some adjustments.
Essentially, she's saying that we need to work harder.
The problem is essentially a lack of funding.

vn_meaning: động từ: thiết lập; thành lập; chứng minh; khẳng định
eng_explanation: verb: to set up or create; to prove or demonstrate.
example: The company aims to establish a strong presence in the market.
They need to establish a clear timeline for the project.
Scientists are trying to establish a link between diet and health.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự thành lập; cơ sở; giới thượng lưu
eng_explanation: noun: the act of establishing something; an institution; the upper class.
example: The establishment of the new company created many jobs.
The museum is a significant cultural establishment.
He comes from a wealthy and influential establishment.

vn_meaning: trạng từ: thậm chí; tính từ: chẵn, đều, bằng phẳng; động từ: làm cho bằng phẳng, cân bằng.
eng_explanation: adv.: used to emphasize something surprising; adj.: divisible by two (number).
example: Even though it was raining, we went for a walk.
She has an even number of shoes.
Try to keep the surface even.

vn_meaning: danh từ: buổi tối, chiều tối.
eng_explanation: n.: the period of time at the end of the day, typically from 6 pm to bedtime.
example: We spent a pleasant evening at home.
Good evening, everyone.
The evening news is on now.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự kiện, biến cố.
eng_explanation: n.: something that happens, especially something important or unusual.
example: The concert was a major event.
The company is organizing a fundraising event.
Unexpected events can disrupt plans.

vn_meaning: trạng từ: cuối cùng, về sau.
eng_explanation: adv.: in the end; after some time or difficulty.
example: She eventually agreed to help us.
He eventually became a successful doctor.
The rain eventually stopped.

vn_meaning: trạng từ: bao giờ, từng; tính từ: vĩnh cửu, thường trực.
eng_explanation: adv.: at any time; used in questions and negative statements. adj.: lasting forever.
example: Have you ever been to Paris?
I've never seen anything like it ever.
He dreamed of ever lasting peace.

vn_meaning: tính từ: mỗi, mọi.
eng_explanation: adj.: used before nouns to indicate all members of a group.
example: Every student must attend the meeting.
I read every book in the series.
Every cloud has a silver lining.

vn_meaning: đại từ: tất cả mọi người, ai cũng.
eng_explanation: pron.: all the people; everyone.
example: Everybody is welcome to the party.
Everybody knows that smoking is harmful.
Is everybody ready to go?

vn_meaning: tính từ: hàng ngày, thường ngày.
eng_explanation: adj.: occurring or done each day; ordinary.
example: This is my everyday car.
She wears everyday clothes.
Everyday life can be stressful.

vn_meaning: đại từ: tất cả mọi người, ai cũng.
eng_explanation: pron.: all the people; everybody.
example: Everyone enjoyed the concert.
Everyone deserves a second chance.
I thanked everyone for their help.

vn_meaning: đại từ: tất cả mọi thứ, mọi việc.
eng_explanation: pron.: all things; all that exists.
example: I lost everything in the fire.
Everything is going to be alright.
She knows everything about him.

vn_meaning: đã ở khắp mọi nơi; bao phủ toàn bộ
eng_explanation: It covers everything; it's ubiquitous.
example: The evidence supports the theory of evolution.
The evidence was undeniable; it was everywhere.

vn_meaning: hậu chứng, bằng chứng
eng_explanation: It's the proof that supports a claim.
example: The evidence presented was compelling.
The evidence was crucial to the investigation.

vn_meaning: đáng tin cậy, rõ ràng
eng_explanation: It's obvious or easily seen.
example: The evidence was evident to everyone.
The evidence suggested a connection.

vn_meaning: xấu, ác
eng_explanation: It's morally wrong and harmful.
example: The evidence showed a terrible evil act.
He was consumed by evil thoughts.

vn_meaning: gợi ý, gợi nhớ
eng_explanation: It's to remind or suggest something.
example: The scent evoked memories of childhood.
The painting evoked a sense of sadness.

vn_meaning: diễn biến, tiến hóa
eng_explanation: It's the process of change over time.
example: The evolutionary theory explains the diversity of life.
The evolutionary process continues to shape our world.

vn_meaning: diễn biến, tiến hóa
eng_explanation: It's the process of change over time.
example: The theory of evolution explains the diversity of life.
Natural selection is a key driver of evolution.

vn_meaning: phát triển, tiến hóa
eng_explanation: It means to change into a more advanced form.
example: The animals evolved over millions of years.
The species evolved to adapt to its environment.

vn_meaning: đầy chính xác, hoàn hảo
eng_explanation: It's perfectly accurate or precise.
example: The results were exact; there were no errors.
The details were exact; every detail was noted.

vn_meaning: đầy chính xác, hoàn hảo
eng_explanation: It's perfectly accurate or precise.
example: The measurements were exactly as expected.
The answer was exactly what was needed.

vn_meaning: động từ: phóng đại (sự thật); tính từ: phóng đại (quá mức)
eng_explanation: Verb: To represent something as better or worse than it really is. Adjective: Overstating something.
example: He exaggerated his accomplishments to impress his boss.
Don't exaggerate the severity of the situation.
The news report exaggerated the danger of the storm.

vn_meaning: danh từ: kỳ thi; danh từ: bài kiểm tra
eng_explanation: Noun: A test or assessment, typically taken in a school or university.
example: I have an exam tomorrow that I'm not prepared for.
The students took the final exam with confidence.
She studied hard for her math exam.

vn_meaning: danh từ: quá trình kiểm tra; danh từ: kỳ thi (phức tạp)
eng_explanation: Noun: The process of testing someone's knowledge or skills; a formal test.
example: The examination process took several hours.
She passed the medical examination with flying colors.
The university conducts regular examinations throughout the semester.

vn_meaning: động từ: kiểm tra; động từ: nghiên cứu kỹ lưỡng
eng_explanation: Verb: To inspect carefully; to study thoroughly.
example: The doctor will examine your symptoms.
Scientists examine the effects of pollution on the environment.
Please examine the document for any errors.

vn_meaning: danh từ: ví dụ; danh từ: mẫu vật
eng_explanation: Noun: A thing that serves as an illustration or model.  A physical instance.
example: Here's an example of how to solve the problem.
The teacher used an example to explain the concept.
The scientist collected an example of the rare plant.

vn_meaning: động từ: vượt quá; tính từ: vượt quá
eng_explanation: Verb: To go beyond a limit. Adjective: Greater than or surpassing.
example: The price of the ticket exceeds my budget.
The company exceeded its sales targets this year.
The temperature will exceed 30 degrees Celsius tomorrow.

vn_meaning: Danh từ: sự xuất sắc; Danh từ: phẩm chất tốt nhất
eng_explanation: Noun: The quality of being outstanding; the highest level of something.
example: She achieved excellence in her field.
The company prides itself on its commitment to excellence.
He demonstrated excellence in both his work and his personal life.

vn_meaning: tính từ: xuất sắc; tính từ: tốt nhất
eng_explanation: Adjective: Extremely good; outstanding.
example: She is an excellent student.
The food at the restaurant was excellent.
He gave an excellent performance in the play.

vn_meaning: phó từ: trừ; động từ: loại trừ
eng_explanation: Preposition/Conjunction: Excluding something. Verb: To exclude or omit.
example: Everyone is invited except John.
I like all fruits except bananas.
Please except any errors you find.

vn_meaning: danh từ: trường hợp ngoại lệ; danh từ: ngoại lệ
eng_explanation: Noun: A case that does not follow the general rule; an unusual circumstance.
example: There was an exception to the rule.
The exception proved the rule.
He made an exception to his policy for her.

vn_meaning: tính từ: phi thường, xuất sắc (chất lượng); danh từ: trường hợp đặc biệt, ngoại lệ (sự kiện)
eng_explanation: adjective: unusually good; outstanding. Noun: an unusual or rare event or person.
example: The athlete's performance was exceptional.
Due to exceptional circumstances, the meeting was postponed.
This is an exceptional opportunity to learn a new skill.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự dư thừa, vượt quá mức cho phép; số lượng vượt quá nhu cầu
eng_explanation: noun: a quantity that exceeds what is strictly necessary or desirable.
example: There was a large excess of food at the party.
The company is operating with a significant budget excess.
He drank alcohol in excess of the recommended amount.

vn_meaning: tính từ: quá mức, quá đáng, vượt quá giới hạn
eng_explanation: adjective: beyond what is reasonable or necessary; immoderate.
example: The price of the tickets was excessive.
He showed excessive enthusiasm for the project.
The amount of sugar in the drink is excessive.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự trao đổi; sự đổi chác; động từ: trao đổi, đổi chác
eng_explanation: noun: the action of giving one thing and receiving another. Verb: to give something and receive something in return.
example: We had a lively exchange of ideas.
I'd like to exchange this shirt for a different size.
The two countries agreed to an exchange of prisoners.

vn_meaning: tính từ: hào hứng, phấn khích; động từ: làm cho ai đó hào hứng, phấn khích
eng_explanation: adjective: very enthusiastic and eager. Verb: to make someone feel very happy and enthusiastic.
example: The children were excited about the trip to the zoo.
The news excited her greatly.
The prospect of winning the lottery excited him.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự hào hứng, phấn khích; sự hứng thú
eng_explanation: noun: a feeling of great happiness and enthusiasm.
example: There was a palpable sense of excitement in the air.
The rollercoaster ride was full of excitement.
She felt a surge of excitement when she opened the letter.

vn_meaning: tính từ: thú vị, hấp dẫn, gây hứng thú
eng_explanation: adjective: causing excitement and interest; thrilling.
example: It was an exciting game to watch.
She's living an exciting life.
The new movie is very exciting.

vn_meaning: động từ: loại trừ, bỏ ra ngoài; không bao gồm
eng_explanation: verb: to prevent someone or something from entering or being included.
example: The survey excluded participants under the age of 18.
He was excluded from the team for disciplinary reasons.
The price does not include taxes.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự loại trừ; sự bỏ qua; sự không bao gồm
eng_explanation: noun: the act of preventing someone or something from entering or being included.
example: The exclusion of women from the study was criticized.
His exclusion from the meeting was a deliberate act.
The contract contains a clause regarding exclusion of liability.

vn_meaning: tính từ: độc quyền, duy nhất; đặc biệt, thượng hạng; danh từ: sản phẩm độc quyền, sản phẩm cao cấp
eng_explanation: adjective: exclusively available or suitable for one person or group. High-quality or luxurious.
example: This is an exclusive interview with the CEO.
They live in an exclusive residential area.
The store sells exclusive designer clothing.

vn_meaning: động từ: tồn tại (thực tế); sống (cuộc sống).
eng_explanation: v. to continue to live or occur; to be real (PoS: verb).
example: Does life exist on other planets?
Evidence suggests dinosaurs once existed.
Problems still exist despite our efforts.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự tồn tại; sự sống.
eng_explanation: n. the fact of being alive or happening; being (PoS: noun).
example: The existence of God is a matter of faith.
Her existence was a secret for many years.
The threat to their existence is very real.

vn_meaning: danh từ: lối ra; động từ: rời khỏi, thoát ra.
eng_explanation: n. a way out; v. to leave (PoS: noun, verb).
example: Follow the signs to the nearest exit.
The performer made a dramatic exit.
We need to exit the building immediately.

vn_meaning: tính từ: kỳ lạ, lạ thường; ngoại lai.
eng_explanation: adj. strikingly unusual or unfamiliar; foreign (PoS: adjective).
example: They visited an exotic island in the Pacific.
The restaurant served exotic fruits and spices.
She has an exotic accent.

vn_meaning: động từ: mở rộng; phát triển.
eng_explanation: v. to become larger or wider; to grow (PoS: verb).
example: The company plans to expand its operations.
The universe is constantly expanding.
He expanded on his ideas during the presentation.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự mở rộng; sự phát triển.
eng_explanation: n. the act of becoming larger; growth (PoS: noun).
example: The city is undergoing rapid expansion.
The expansion of the railway network was crucial.
Economic expansion led to more jobs.

vn_meaning: động từ: mong đợi; dự kiến.
eng_explanation: v. to regard something as likely to happen; anticipate (PoS: verb).
example: I expect to finish the project by Friday.
We didn't expect so many people to attend.
Don't expect miracles.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự mong đợi; sự dự kiến.
eng_explanation: n. a strong belief that something will happen (PoS: noun).
example: Her performance exceeded all expectations.
The expectations placed on young athletes are high.
He failed to meet their expectations.

vn_meaning: tính từ: được mong đợi; dự kiến.
eng_explanation: adj. generally anticipated; predicted (PoS: adjective).
example: The expected arrival time is 6 PM.
He earned an expected salary increase.
There was an expected delay due to the weather.

vn_meaning: danh từ: cuộc thám hiểm; đoàn thám hiểm.
eng_explanation: n. a journey undertaken for a specific purpose (PoS: noun).
example: The explorers embarked on a dangerous expedition.
A scientific expedition was sent to the Amazon.
The expedition discovered several new species.

vn_meaning: Chi tiêu (tài chính, kinh tế); khoản tiền bỏ ra để mua sắm hoặc sử dụng.
eng_explanation: Expenditure refers to the spending of money or resources.
example: The company had a significant expenditure on marketing.
We need to manage our expenses carefully.

vn_meaning: Chi phí (tài chính, kinh tế); khoản tiền phải trả.
eng_explanation: An expense is a cost incurred.
example: The team faced an unexpected expense.
Please submit your expense report promptly.

vn_meaning: Đắt đỏ (tài chính, sản phẩm);có giá cao.
eng_explanation: Expensive means costly.
example: That car is very expensive.
The restaurant offers a delicious and expensive meal.

vn_meaning: Kinh nghiệm (công việc, cuộc sống);sự kiện, hoạt động đã trải qua.
eng_explanation: Experience refers to the knowledge and skills gained through doing something.
example: Having a good experience at the hotel was wonderful.
He gained valuable experience working on the project.

vn_meaning: Có kinh nghiệm (công việc, cuộc sống);đã từng trải qua.
eng_explanation: Experienced means having a proven track record.
example: The team hired a highly experienced technician.
She is an experienced traveler, exploring different cultures.

vn_meaning: Thử nghiệm (công việc, lý thuyết);một thí nghiệm để tìm ra kết quả.
eng_explanation: An experiment is a test or investigation.
example: Scientists are conducting an experiment to test the new drug.
The experiment aimed to prove the theory.

vn_meaning: Thử nghiệm (công việc, lý thuyết);một thí nghiệm được thực hiện.
eng_explanation: An experimental is a test conducted under controlled conditions.
example: The researchers conducted an experimental study on the effects of sunlight.
The new technology is an experimental design.

vn_meaning: Chuyên gia (công việc, kiến thức);người có kiến thức và kỹ năng chuyên sâu.
eng_explanation: An expert is someone with extensive knowledge.
example: He is an expert in artificial intelligence.
She is an expert in marketing.

vn_meaning: Kinh nghiệm chuyên sâu (công việc, kiến thức);kiến thức chuyên sâu.
eng_explanation: Expertise refers to a high level of knowledge in a particular field.
example: The company relies on its expert team for technical support.
She possesses a wealth of expertise in environmental science.

vn_meaning: Hết hạn (sản phẩm, thời gian);sản phẩm hết hạn.
eng_explanation: Expire means to end or cease.
example: The product expires on December 31st.
The deadline for the project has expired.

vn_meaning: tính từ: có tính nổ; mạnh mẽ, gây sốc (cảm xúc, tình huống)
eng_explanation: adj. Capable of exploding; relating to explosives. Also: dramatically increasing. (explosive growth)
example: The bomb was highly explosive.
The situation is extremely explosive and could escalate quickly.
The company experienced explosive growth in the last quarter.

vn_meaning: động từ: xuất khẩu; danh từ: hàng hóa xuất khẩu
eng_explanation: v. To send goods to another country for sale. n. Goods sent to another country. (export market)
example: The country exports a lot of rice.
Coffee is one of Brazil's main exports.
The company is looking to expand its export business.

vn_meaning: động từ: phơi bày, bộc lộ; vạch trần, đưa ra ánh sáng
eng_explanation: v. To reveal or uncover something hidden. Also: to leave vulnerable to harm. (expose film)
example: The scandal exposed corruption within the company.
Don't expose the film to direct sunlight.
He exposed himself to danger by going out alone at night.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự tiếp xúc; sự phơi bày; sự bộc lộ
eng_explanation: n. The state of being exposed to something. Also: the amount of light reaching a photographic surface.
example: Prolonged exposure to the sun can cause skin damage.
The newspaper gave the story extensive exposure.
The camera settings control the exposure.

vn_meaning: động từ: bày tỏ, diễn đạt; thể hiện
eng_explanation: v. To convey a thought or feeling in words or actions. (express an opinion)
example: She expressed her gratitude for their help.
The artist uses color to express emotions.
He expressed concern about the project's progress.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự bày tỏ, sự diễn đạt; cách diễn đạt; thành ngữ
eng_explanation: n. The act of conveying a thought or feeling. Also: a word or phrase. (facial expression)
example: Freedom of expression is a fundamental right.
His face showed no expression.
The idiom is a common expression in this region.

vn_meaning: động từ: kéo dài, mở rộng; duỗi ra; đề nghị, gửi tới
eng_explanation: v. To make something longer or larger. Also: to offer or provide. (extend an invitation)
example: They decided to extend their stay in Paris.
The company plans to extend its operations to Asia.
Please extend my thanks to your team.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự kéo dài, sự mở rộng; phần mở rộng; số điện thoại nội bộ
eng_explanation: n. The act of extending something. Also: an added part. (house extension)
example: The building is undergoing an extension.
He asked for a three-month extension on the deadline.
Dial 225 for extension 123.

vn_meaning: tính từ: rộng lớn, bao la; tỉ mỉ, chi tiết
eng_explanation: adj. Covering a large area or amount. Also: very thorough. (extensive research)
example: The library has an extensive collection of books.
The damage caused by the storm was extensive.
She conducted extensive research for her thesis.

vn_meaning: trạng từ: một cách rộng rãi, tỉ mỉ
eng_explanation: adv. In a thorough or widespread manner. (extensively studied)
example: The topic has been extensively researched.
The product was tested extensively before launch.
The author traveled extensively throughout Europe.

vn_meaning: mức độ
eng_explanation: It refers to the total or maximum size or scope of something.
example: The extent of the damage was significant.
The extent of his knowledge is vast.

vn_meaning: bên ngoài
eng_explanation: It describes something that is not inside or contained within.
example: The external temperature was unusually high.
The external forces affected the structure.

vn_meaning: thêm
eng_explanation: It signifies an addition or an excess.
example: I need extra coffee to drink.
He has extra money in his wallet.

vn_meaning: chiết xuất
eng_explanation: It involves isolating a specific part of something.
example: The software automatically extracts data from the file.
Researchers extract valuable insights from the research.

vn_meaning: Very unusual or remarkable.
eng_explanation: It indicates something that is exceptional or stands out from the ordinary.
example: The extraordinary performance of the athlete was impressive.
She displayed extraordinary kindness.

vn_meaning: Very high or low; extreme.
eng_explanation: It describes something that is beyond the normal range.
example: The weather was extremely hot.
He experienced extreme sadness.

vn_meaning: cực kỳ
eng_explanation: It emphasizes the intensity of a quality.
example: He is extremely talented.
The movie was extremely thrilling.

vn_meaning: A person who advocates or practices extreme views or actions.
eng_explanation: It refers to someone who holds radical or uncompromising beliefs.
example: The extremist group is promoting violence.
His extremist views caused controversy.

vn_meaning: mắt
eng_explanation: It describes the sensory organ responsible for vision.
example: The doctor examined his eye.
She has a condition that affects her eye.

vn_meaning: Cloth; a woven material.
eng_explanation: It refers to a textile material.
example: The dress was made of luxurious fabric.
The fabric is very durable.

vn_meaning: danh từ: điều kỳ diệu; tính từ: tuyệt vời, đáng kinh ngạc (về vẻ đẹp, tài năng, thành tựu)
eng_explanation: adj. extraordinarily good; superlatively wonderful.
example: She had a fabulous time at the concert.
The sunset over the ocean was absolutely fabulous.
He is a fabulous dancer with incredible talent.

vn_meaning: danh từ: khuôn mặt; danh từ: tình huống, vấn đề; động từ: đối mặt (với vấn đề)
eng_explanation: n. the human face; v. to confront or deal with.
example: She admired her reflection in the mirror.
He had to face the consequences of his actions.
The company is facing a difficult economic situation.

vn_meaning: động từ: tạo điều kiện, giúp đỡ; danh từ: điều kiện, sự hỗ trợ
eng_explanation: v. to make something easier; n. something that helps or enables.
example: The grant will facilitate research projects.
The new software facilitates communication between teams.
Access to funding can facilitate business growth.

vn_meaning: danh từ: cơ sở vật chất, tiện nghi; danh từ: khả năng, kỹ năng
eng_explanation: n. a place equipped for a particular activity; n. ability or skill.
example: The hotel has a swimming pool and fitness facility.
She has a natural facility for languages.
The new factory boasts state-of-the-art facilities.

vn_meaning: danh từ: sự thật, hiện thực; danh từ: sự kiện, điều kiện
eng_explanation: n. something that is true; a real occurrence or event.
example: It's a simple fact that exercise is good for you.
The fact that he was late surprised everyone.
Let's stick to the facts and avoid speculation.

vn_meaning: danh từ: phe nhóm, nhóm người; danh từ: sự chia rẽ, xung đột
eng_explanation: n. a smaller group within a larger organization or movement.
example: The party was divided into several factions.
Political factions often compete for power.
The disagreement led to a faction forming within the company.

vn_meaning: danh từ: yếu tố, nhân tố; danh từ: hệ số, thừa số
eng_explanation: n. something that influences a result; n. a mathematical number multiplying another.
example: Poverty is a major factor in crime rates.
Temperature is an important factor in plant growth.
The interest rate is a key factor in determining loan affordability.

vn_meaning: danh từ: nhà máy, xưởng sản xuất
eng_explanation: n. a building or complex where goods are manufactured.
example: The factory produces thousands of cars each year.
The factory workers are unionized.
The new factory will create hundreds of jobs.

vn_meaning: danh từ: giảng viên, đội ngũ giảng dạy; danh từ: khả năng, năng lực
eng_explanation: n. the body of teachers at a college or university; n. mental or physical power.
example: The university's faculty is renowned for its expertise.
She has a strong faculty for problem-solving.
The faculty voted to approve the new curriculum.

vn_meaning: động từ: phai nhạt, mờ dần; tính từ: nhạt màu, mờ nhạt
eng_explanation: v. to become less intense or visible; adj. losing color or brightness.
example: The colors of the painting began to fade over time.
His memory is starting to fade.
The sunset faded into the horizon.

vn_meaning: động từ: không thành công (trong một việc gì đó); hỏng, trục trặc (máy móc); không vượt qua (kiểm tra, bài thi).
eng_explanation: verb: to be unsuccessful in achieving a goal; to not meet a required standard.
example: He failed the exam, so he needs to study harder.
The project failed due to lack of funding.
Don't fail to bring your passport on the trip.

vn_meaning: tính từ: thất bại; hỏng, trục trặc.
eng_explanation: adjective: unsuccessful; having failed to achieve a purpose.
example: The failed attempt resulted in a significant loss.
The failed hard drive contained important data.
